meanings.definition: The land next to the sea; seashore.
meanings.sent1: We had a picnic on the coast and watched the waves.
meanings.sent2: The beach is a popular spot along the coast for tourists.
meanings.sent3: The sandcastle competition brought many people to the coast.
meanings.sent4: The seagulls danced above the coast, looking for food.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the coast in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To move without power or effort; drift.
meanings.sent1: The boat began to coast smoothly on the calm water.
meanings.sent2: The bicycle started to coast down the hill effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The leaf decided to coast along the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: The car seemed to coast through the empty streets at night.
meanings.sent5: The balloon continued to coast through the sky with ease.

meanings.sent1: We planned to coast along the beautiful shoreline on our boat.
meanings.sent2: The sailors decided to coast near the coast for a scenic route.
meanings.sent3: The pirates attempted to coast stealthily along the coast.
meanings.sent4: The cruise ship will coast slowly past the stunning coast.
meanings.sent5: The fishermen love to coast peacefully along the coast.
